entities.name: Fiatjaf
entities.description: Fiatjaf is a Brazilian software developer born in 1991, known as the founder of the decentralized social protocol Nostr launched in 2020. He works remotely for Zebedee, overseeing Bitcoin-related projects including Nostr, and has received funding from Jack Dorsey.[1][2][3][4]
entities.title: Founder
entities.role: Creator and lead developer of Nostr

entities.name: Giovanni Torres Parra
entities.description: Giovanni Torres Parra is a Brazilian software developer known as the anonymous leader of the Nostr protocol, who received a $10M donation from Jack Dorsey in 2024. He has created websites promoting the work of Olavo de Carvalho and operates a hostel in southeastern Brazil.

entities.name: Martti Malmi
entities.description: Finnish computer scientist and one of the earliest Bitcoin developers who contributed to Bitcoin's source code alongside Satoshi Nakamoto starting in 2009. Currently involved with cryptocurrency and blockchain projects including Gun and other decentralized initiatives.
entities.title: Developer

entities.name: Miljan Braticevic
entities.description: Founder & CEO of Primal, a decentralized social media platform built on the Nostr protocol that combines Bitcoin integration with censorship-resistant communication.
entities.title: Founder & CEO
tags: funding:$1M seed round led by Ten31 with participation from Hivemind

entities.name: Jack Dorsey
entities.description: Jack Dorsey is an American businessman, co-founder of Twitter (now X), where he served as CEO from 2007–2008 and 2015–2021, and co-founder, chairman, and Block Head of Block, Inc. (formerly Square).[1][4]
entities.title: Co-founder of Twitter

entities.name: Nostr
entities.description: Decentralized social media protocol (Notes and Other Stuff Transmitted by Relays) created in 2020, emphasizing user data ownership and censorship resistance.

entities.name: Primal
entities.description: Social application built on the Nostr protocol, founded by Miljan Braticevic to offer intuitive decentralized social networking.

entities.name: Iris
entities.description: Social media app integrating Nostr, developed with contributions from early Bitcoin developer Martti Malmi.

entities.name: Damus
entities.description: Popular iOS app for Nostr developed by William Casarin, highlighting open protocol interoperability.

entities.name: Amethyst
entities.description: Open-source Nostr client created by Vitor Pamplona, empowering creators through decentralized, censorship-resistant social media.

entities.name: Open Sats Initiative
entities.description: Nonprofit supporting Bitcoin-related projects including Nostr; received $10 million donation from Jack Dorsey for Nostr development.

entities.name: William Casarin
entities.description: Developer behind Damus, a popular Nostr iOS app, who switched from Mastodon due to censorship issues.
entities.title: Developer

entities.name: Vitor Pamplona
entities.description: Creator of Amethyst, an open-source Nostr client focused on decentralized social media.
entities.title: Creator

entities.name: Ben Arc
entities.description: Welsh software developer who collaborated with Fiatjaf starting in 2019, contributing to Nostr's development inspired by Bitcoin marketplaces.

entities.name: Edward Snowden
entities.description: Edward Snowden is the American whistleblower who revealed global mass surveillance programs in 2013 and is the author of the international bestseller Permanent Record. He currently serves as president of the board of directors of the Freedom of the Press Foundation.[4]

entities.name: fiatjaf
entities.description: Pseudonymous lead developer of the Nostr protocol, frustrated by Twitter's censorship, who began developing Nostr for decentralized identity and social networking. Works remotely for Zebedee overseeing NBD.WTF projects including Nostr.
entities.title: Nostr Developer

entities.name: Ben Arc
entities.description: Welsh software developer who collaborated with fiatjaf starting in 2019 on Bitcoin-related projects, contributing ideas to Nostr's development for marketplaces and decentralized networks.

entities.name: Andre Neves
entities.description: Co-founder of Zebedee, a video game startup, who recruited fiatjaf for a full-time remote role to oversee NBD.WTF projects encompassing Nostr.
entities.title: Co-founder

entities.name: nostrica
entities.description: Nostrica is a Nostr relay operator (wss://relay.nostrica.com) associated with Damus, a decentralized social network on the Nostr protocol founded by William Casarin.
entities.title: Founder

entities.name: Alex Gleason
entities.description: Member of nostr-protocol GitHub organization, contributing to Nostr protocol development.

entities.name: Carlito BrightonBTC
entities.description: Member of nostr-protocol GitHub organization, active in Nostr development.

entities.name: Ricardo Cabral
entities.description: Developer known as cameri, member of nostr-protocol GitHub organization involved in Nostr.

entities.name: Pablo Fernandez
entities.description: Technical advisor deeply involved with Nostr, highlights its ease of building applications; active as pablof7z in nostr-protocol GitHub.

entities.name: Giszmo
entities.description: Leo Wandersleb, member of nostr-protocol GitHub organization contributing to Nostr.

entities.name: KoalaSat
entities.description: Member of nostr-protocol GitHub organization, engaged in Nostr protocol work.

entities.name: mattn
entities.description: Developer in nostr-protocol GitHub organization supporting Nostr development.

entities.name: hodlbod
entities.description: Developer known as staab, member of nostr-protocol GitHub contributing to Nostr.

entities.name: v0l
entities.description: Kieran, member of nostr-protocol GitHub organization involved in Nostr.

entities.name: Melvin Carvalho
entities.description: Proposed the W3C Nostr Community Group in 2023 to foster intersection with web standards.

entities.name: Kingsley Idehen
entities.description: Supporter of W3C Nostr Community Group creation for web standards integration.

entities.name: Nathan Rixham
entities.description: Supported the launch of W3C Nostr Community Group.

entities.name: Daniel Renfer
entities.description: Supporter of W3C Nostr Community Group for documenting Nostr patterns.

entities.name: Andrei Ciortea
entities.description: Backed the creation of W3C Nostr Community Group.

entities.name: Nostr Dev Team
entities.description: Team focused on building native Android apps and tools for Nostr, seeking developers for Graphene OS compatibility.

entities.name: nostr-protocol
entities.description: GitHub organization hosting Nostr protocol repositories and developers.
